intro: Euchiton paludosus, commonly known as the swamp echinata, is a flowering plant native to wetland habitats in North America. It is a member of the Rubiaceae family, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant features showy, five-petaled white to pale pink flowers that bloom in clusters during the summer months. Its leaves are opposite, simple, and often have a slightly serrated edge. Euchiton paludosus thrives in moist, acidic soils and is often found in marshes and along the edges of ponds.
